qas.question: What did the development of new imperialism cause?

answers.text: the conquest of nearly all eastern hemisphere territories by colonial powers.

qas.question: When did the commercial colonization of India begin?
What happened n the battle of Plassey?

answers.text: Nawab of Bengal surrendered his dominions to the British East India Company

qas.question: When was the British East Company given the right to collect revenue?
What is the term used to describe the "Right to collect revenue"?

context: The development of New Imperialism saw <a0_0>the conquest of nearly all eastern hemisphere territories by colonial powers.<a0_0/> The commercial colonization of India commenced in <a1_0>1757<a1_0/>, after the Battle of Plassey, when the <a2_0>Nawab of Bengal surrendered his dominions to the British East India Company<a2_0/>, in <a3_0>1765<a3_0/>, when the Company was granted the <a4_0>diwani<a4_0/>, or the right to collect revenue, in Bengal and Bihar, or in 1772, when the Company established a capital in Calcutta, appointed its first Governor-General, Warren Hastings, and became directly involved in governance.
